Description: Hello Everyone: What I have available is a 1998 Made in Korea Les Paul Standard by Epiphone, It weighs around 9 pounds, It has a long tenon neck joint, The guitar has had some work done to it as far as upgrades goes, A pair of dragonfire humbuckers installed, 8.2k ohm in the neck, 13.2k ohm in the bridge, these are rough readings, The tuning keys were replaced with Stewart Macdonald golden age by Gotoh, the originals were worn and sloppy, no holes were drilled these fit in the stock screw holes, The bridge and the tailpiece were replaced, The tailpiece studs were replaced with USA spec Kluson brass studs and steel bushings, A bone nut was installed, the previous owner replaced most of cream plastic parts with black ones, the input jack plate has cracks in it, The guitar has numerous dings and such on the body and the headstock, but there is no cracks, no breaks, and no headstock repairs, There is a spot on the back where you can see the wood seams under the finish, The frets have some wear, mainly between the first and fifth fret, but in my opinion there is 70% life left, The guitar is twenty years old and it has some great sustain, it was strung up with Ernie ball 10's recently, It comes with a gig bag, THE GUITAR IS SOLD AS IS WITH NO WARRANTY. , Any questions ?, please ask prior to bidding, Payment from the winning bidder should be received within 5 days end of auction, Thank you for looking, and good luck bidding.
Title: 1998 Epiphone Les Paul Standard Black MIK Korea Long tenon neck upgraded
ConditionDescription: A used Epiphone Les Paul with gig bag
